subject: RE: [junit] Rant: assertEquals(String, String) -- strdiff'ing is a bad idea
msgSnippet: ... The Eclipse Junit view even has a compare actual with expected test result button which will show you the whole strings and highlight the differences.
messageBody:
> I prefer this type of error to the ubiquitous NPE,...at least
> here, I know that I can go into Eclipse, and run that test,
> and doubleclick on the error, to bring me to the line that
> called it and compare my strings manually

The Eclipse Junit view even has a "compare actual with expected test result"
button which will show you the whole strings and highlight the differences.

> But, yes, I find it humorous and sometimes annoying to see
> that type of output in the test results from the
> nightlybuild. Maybe it could made into some sort of
> configuration, so that you could toggle whether you want
> verbose comparisonFailures or succinct comparisonFailures?

If I remember correctly, junit-addons provides an assertEquals method that
also shows some of the surrounding of the found difference.

Cheers, Ilja
